page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area in the block is a rural one with a cultivated grassland/forestry landscape and includes two villages:Morland and Cliburn and a very small part of Great Strickland. There are no steep hills or large areas of flat land as the relief is one of shallow river valleys and ridges between. Because of the number of plantations and small woods and the very large number of major trees standing in the hedgerows, it appears that the area is more heavily wooded than it actually is. Apart from the houses in the villages the area is scattered with isolated farms with the differing range of farm buildings such as barn,milk sheds,machinery store,grain or slurry store towers and farm house.
